alert.note: Alert for Northeast Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 10 at 3:14PM PST until January 12 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A POWERFUL WINTER STORM WILL IMPACT MUCH OF THE REGION ON THURSDAY INTO EARLY FRIDAY... .A powerful winter storm will impact much of the region on Thursday into early Friday. This storm will deliver widespread snow which will be heavy over the Cascades and portions of southeast Washington and north-central Idaho. The snow will generally taper off Friday followed by an intrusion of bitter arctic air and dangerously cold wind chill values. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM THURSDAY TO 4 AM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. Additionally wind gusts of 20 to 25 mph in open areas could result in blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...Newport, Tiger, Chewelah, Orin-Rice Road, Ione, Metaline Falls, Springdale-Hunters Road, Flowery Trail Road, Metaline, Northport, Colville, Deer Park, Fruitland, and Kettle Falls. * WHEN...From 4 AM Thursday to 4 AM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. In Idaho, for the latest road information in Idaho, call 5 1 1. In Washington, for the latest travel information in Washington, go to https://wsdot.wa.gov/travel
